text:
2H+ + 2e- → H20 (Yükseltgen olan H+
, elektron alarak H0’ a indirgenir.)
------------------------------
Zn0 + 2H+→ Zn2+ + H20 (Toplam redoks tepkimesi)
(BU TEPKİMELER (TOPLAM 5 TEPKİME), BU İFADELER VE DENEYLE İLGİLİ KENDİNİZE AİT YORUM YAZILACAK.)
DENEY 4.4 (Deney numarası yazılacak.)
BU DENEY “REDOKS” KONUSUNA ÖRNEKTİR. (BU İFADE YAZILACAK.)
DENEYİN YAPILIŞI: (FÖYDE YAZAN DENEYİN YAPILIŞI-KENDİ İFADELERİNİZLE OLABİLİR-
, VARSA TEPKİMELERİYLE
VE EK BİLGİLERİYLE BİRLİKTE YAZILACAK.)
SONUÇ: (Başlık yazılacak.)
3Cu + 8HNO3 → 3Cu(NO3)2 + 2NO + 4H2O
Metalik bakır Nitrat asidi Bakır (II) nitrat Azot oksit Su
(Cu, gerilim sırasında hidrojenin sağında olmasına ve Deney 4.3’ te görüldüğü gibi HCl’ de tepkime vermemesine karşın, bu denemede
yükseltgen bir asit olan HNO3 ile tepkime vermiştir. Hidrojenin sağ tarafındaki metaller, hidrojene göre daha asal olup, ancak yükseltgen
asitlerle çözünür.)
3Cu0 → 3Cu2+ + 6e- (İndirgen (ya da yüksüz) olan Cu0
, elektron vererek Cu2+’ ya yükseltgenir.)
2N5+ + 6e- → 2N2+ (Yükseltgen olan N5+
, elektron alarak N2+’ ya indirgenir.)
------------------------------------
3Cu0 + 2N5+ → 3Cu2+ + 2N2+ (Toplam redoks tepkimesi)
(BU TEPKİMELER (TOPLAM 4 TEPKİME), BU İFADELER VE DENEYLE İLGİLİ KENDİNİZE AİT YORUM YAZILACAK.)
OXIDATION-REDUCTION (Başlık yazılacak.)
trans:
2H + +2e − →H20 (The oxidizing H+
gains electrons and is reduced to H20​.)
------------------------------
Zn 0 +2H + →Zn 2+ +H 2​ O (Overall redox reaction)
(THESE REACTIONS (A TOTAL OF 5 REACTIONS), THESE EXPRESSIONS, AND THE EXPERIMENT WILL REQUIRE YOUR OWN COMMENTARY.)
EXPERIMENT 4.4 (Experiment number to be added.)
THIS EXPERIMENT IS AN EXAMPLE OF THE "REDOX" TOPIC. (TTHIS PHRASE SHOULD BE WRITTEN.)
EXPERIMENT PROCEDURE: (THE PROCEDURE DESCRIBED IN THE LAB MANUAL – IT CAN BE WRITTEN IN YOUR OWN WORDS,
ALONG WITH ANY REACTIONS
AND ADDITIONAL INFORMATION IF AVAILABLE.)
RESULT: (Title to be written.)
3Cu + 8HNO3 → 3Cu(NO3)2 + 2NO + 4H2O
Copper metal Nitric acid Copper (II) nitrate Nitrogen oxide Water
(Cu, although it is on the right side of hydrogen during the potential and, as seen in Experiment 4.3, does not react with HCl, reacts with the
HNO3 in this experiment. Metals on the right side of hydrogen are more noble
and only dissolve in oxidizing acids.)
3Cu0 → 3Cu2+ + 6e- (The reduced (or neutral) Cu0 is oxidized to
Cu2+ by giving electrons.)
2N5+ + 6e- → 2N2+ (The oxidized N5+
N2+ by accepting electrons.)
------------------------------------
3Cu0 + 2N5+ → 3Cu2+ + 2N2+ (Overall redox reaction)
(THESE REACTIONS (A TOTAL OF 4 REACTIONS), THESE EXPRESSIONS, AND THE EXPERIMENT WILL REQUIRE YOUR OWN COMMENTARY.)
OXIDATION-REDUCTION (Title to be written.)
